casebody.data:
DAVID CHAMPION, PLAINTIFF-RESPONDENT, v. PUBLIC SERVICE CO-ORDINATED TRANSPORT. Submitted May term, 1929 Decided June 12, 1929.

Before Justices Pabkeb, Black and Bodine.

Eor the appellant, Henry H. Fryling. Eor the respondent, Samuel S. Stern. Pee Cukiam.

This is a companion case to No. 405. The trial resulted in a judgment for the plaintiff for $200. The judgment of the District Court is affirmed, with costs, for the reasons stated in No. 405 of the present term.
